page.title: 03THE VETERAN CAR RUN
page.content: The{Veteran Car Rally}is run every year in November. About 300 cars enter but they have to be at least 80 years old. The run is approximately 90 kilometres long and the cars that finish before 4.00pm get a small medal. They start at 8.00am. Motor vehicles other than cars, e.g. fire engines, vans and buses have a rally of their own. The rally runs from Hyde Park in London to the sea front in Brighton. The drivers and passengers do not have to wear special clothes, though the ride is rather cold and it is a good idea to have blankets. Children can ride in the cars too. All the vehicles have engines though some are powered by pedals. The cars come through Horley at about 9.15 to 10.10am and are greeted by crowds.
